oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Womanless Wedding at Hattie R. Cotton School
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: One color window card (blue on white) announcing the presentation of the Womanless Wedding at the Hattie R. Cotton School on March 29. A community tradition popular in the 19th century, a womanless wedding was a staged show where males act out all roles of a traditional wedding party. The event often raised money for charities, civic organizations, and churches.
